note.text: Your interpreter may not have had access to professional training. You can help local interpreters develop their skills so they can do their jobs better and, in turn, help you do your job better.

Conduct a review immediately after each meeting to discuss how to improve. Teach interpreters what you've learned about managing an interpreted conversation. Provide them with basic tools like dictionaries if they don't have access to these things. Spend time learning about each other's cultures and languages. Both you and your interpreter will develop valuable cross-cultural communication skills as a result.
